page.title: 01Part of the Conwy Valley
page.content: The area comprises mainly farmland and some mixed woodland on the west and east banks of the River Conwy,bounded by the high ground of the Carneddau Range to the west and the Denbighshire uplands to the east. The farmland is mainly improved pasture for grazing sheep and beef cattle with rough grazing on the flood plain on the west bank of the river, and some arable land devoted mainly to growing cereals for animal feed. There is a weekly cattle market at Talycafn where is the only road bridge over the river in this area. Dwellings are generally scattered with nuclei at Llanbedr y Cennin, Tyn y Groes and Castell. Employment is in a wide variety of occupations agricuture,industry (Dolgarrog Aluminium works) public services and the retail trade within the area
